info.title: The right to...
info.desc: be treated as an individual.

info.title: The right to...
info.desc: be fully informated about the recruitment process.

info.title: The right to...
info.desc: ask questions and receive true and objective answers from recruitment counselors and members.

info.title: The right to...
info.desc: be treated with respect.

info.title: The right to...
info.desc: be treated as a capable and mature person without being patronized.

info.title: The right to...
info.desc: ask how and why and receive straight answers.

info.title: The right to...
info.desc: have and express opinions to recruitment counselors.

info.title: The right to...
info.desc: have inviolable confidentiality when sharing information with recruitment counselors.

info.title: The right to...
info.desc: make informed choices without undue pressure from others.

info.title: The right to...
info.desc: be fully informed about the binding agreements implicit in the acceptance card signing.

info.title: The right to...
info.desc: make one's own choice and decision and accept full responsibility for the results of that decision.

info.title: The right to...
info.desc: have a positive, safe, and enriching recruitment and new member experience.

info.title: Active
info.desc: A fully initiated member of a sorority with full chapter privileges and responsibilities.

info.title: Alumna
info.desc: A member who has graduated from college. (aka alums)

info.title: Badge
info.desc: The pin or badge worn to designate an active or alumni member of a sorority. New members have a similar badge.

info.title: Bid
info.desc: An official invitation to join a sorority.

info.title: Big Sister
info.desc: An active member assigned to assist and advise a newer member.

info.title: Chapter
info.desc: The local undergraduate group that represents a segment of the national organization.

info.title: Initiation
info.desc: A ceremony during which a new member takes the vows of a chapter to become an active member.

info.title: New Member
info.desc: A student who has accepted a bid from a sorority but has not yet been initiated.

info.title: New Member Education Period
info.desc: The time of education about the sorority between accepting a bid and initiation.

info.title: Potential New Member (PNM)
info.desc: A participant in recruitment.

info.title: Preference
info.desc: The final round of recruitment event after which PNMs sign an agreement listing the remaining chapters in order of preference.

info.title: Recruitment
info.desc: The time in whih sororities meet PNMs and seek out new members.

info.title: Take note after each event.
info.desc: Write down the names of women you met, impressions, what you talked about, and anything else that may help you remember that sorority and that event.

info.title: Be courteous and polite.
info.desc: Ask questions and show interest. If you are not interested, you should still be positive and thank your hostess.

info.title: Look at each sorority as a whole.
info.desc: Do not judge the chapter by an individual member.

info.title: Be mature in your decision-making.
info.desc: Be true to yourself about the chapter with which you feel most comfortable. Listen to your heart and not the opinions of others.

info.title: Keep an open mind!
info.desc: You may be surprised that your opinions have changed or may change during the recruitment process.

info.title: This is a mutual selection process.
info.desc: You are selecting a sorority and a sorority is selecting you. Make sure you make a good impression. Leave each event with the information you will need to make a decision.

info.title: Do not interpret remarks as assurance.
info.desc: Any remarks made at an event should not be interpreted as assurance of an invitation to another event or an invitation to join the sorority. An indivicual member cannot ensure or promise either of these.

info.title: All members have been through recruitment.
info.desc: They will try hard to make you feel comfortable and they are empathetic to your situation. They are nervous and anxious just like you are.

info.title: Discuss feelings and opinions privately.
info.desc: This should be done in the privacy of your room or privately with your Rho Gamma to avoid hurting someone's feelings.
